entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 1.5.26
entry.summary: Economist Dr. Elliot Eisenberg takes a look at the economy in the U.S. and around the world, evaluating 2025 and talking about that could be ahead in 2026.

entry.title: Police Log: January 3 - 5
entry.summary: Roseburg police responded to multiple incidents Jan. 3–5, including arrests for warrants, trespass, harassment, DUII, and probation violations, along with several traffic stops and an injury crash at Diamond Lake Boulevard and Winchester Street.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.5.26
entry.summary: A look at the upcoming Umpqua Fishery Enhancement Derby with organizer Cam Lawler and fishing guide Don Myers.

entry.title: Roseburg Elks Lodge to celebrate 129 birthday with a bash
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Elks Lodge #326 will have its 129th birthday bash this weekend.

entry.title: Local partnership to offer pruning workshop
entry.summary: ELKTON — The Oregon State University Extension Service in Douglas County, in partnership with Umpqua Soil & Water Conservation District, are offering a fruit tree pruning workshop Saturday, Jan. 17.

entry.title: Moon Mountain String Band opens 2026 at The Rosebud Theater
entry.summary: The Moon Mountain String Band brought a variety of tones to The Rosebud Theatre on Saturday night, flooding the stage with a banjo, mandolin, fiddle, an acoustic bass, twin guitars and multiple voices.

entry.title: Local hoopers qualify for Elks' District Hoop Shoot
entry.summary: The Roseburg Elks Lodge held the local annual Hoop Shoot on Dec 3, 2025, with children ages 8-13 joining in at the Fremont Middle School gym in Roseburg.

entry.title: Three-Day Cleanup Restores Daly Property After Nuisance Notice
entry.summary: A Roseburg hillside property was largely cleaned up this weekend (Jan 2 - 4) through a coordinated effort by local volunteers, residents of managed camps, and Elk Island Trading LLC following a nuisance notice issued to the homeowner.

entry.title: Douglas County Commissioners to Hold Public Hearing on Proposed Winchester Ridge Water District
entry.summary: Douglas County commissioners will hold a Jan. 7 public hearing to consider forming the Winchester Ridge Domestic Water Supply District. The proposal would create a new water utility entity for residents in the unincorporated Winchester Ridge area.

entry.title: Oran Mor Artisan Mead Closes Roseburg Tasting Room After 10 Years, Relocates Production Near Portland
entry.summary: After 10 years in Roseburg, Oran Mor Artisan Mead has closed its Roseburg tasting room following the relocation of its production closer to Portland. The company says it is not closing and will continue operating at its new location.

entry.title: Man Dies After Stabbing at “The Point” in Roseburg; Juvenile Taken Into Custody
entry.summary: Roseburg police responded to a reported stabbing near SE Pine Street Thursday morning where a 60-year-old man was found with a fatal stab wound. A juvenile suspect was later taken into custody. No further details have been released.

entry.title: Roseburg teen arrested in South Umpqua River after stabbing
entry.summary: A Roseburg teen was arrested Friday in connection with the fatal stabbing that happened in the area of Southeast Pine Street, according to the Roseburg Police Department.

entry.title: Police Log - January 1, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests on Jan. 1, including theft, criminal trespass, assault on an officer, and warrant cases. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections following separate incidents across the city.

entry.title: Douglas CARES pauses operations due to financial crisis
entry.summary: Douglas CARES, the only Child Advocacy Center in Douglas County, is pausing operations starting Jan. 1 due to severe financial issues. This pause is expected to last until at least Feb.1.

entry.title: Youth programs at Roseburg Public Library
entry.summary: It’s a new year, and that means an updated youth program schedule at Roseburg Public Library.

entry.title: Cats are overtaking my garden!
entry.summary: Question: My garden is being overrun by uninvited cats. They dig up my raised bed vegetables, defecate in the soil and chew on my plants. What can I do to keep them out?

entry.summary: Mary Gilbert of the Mary Gilbert Group Powered by Place at Keller Williams Southern Oregon has our weekly look at local real estate

entry.title: Two town hall meetings planned for Douglas County Commissioner Candidates
entry.summary: Two County Commissioner Candidate Town Halls are planned this January, in which the communities of Drain and Reedsport are invited for a conversation with the current lineup of Douglas County Commissioner candidates.

entry.title: The remarkable story of Tyrone Powell
entry.summary: During my 30 years as a newspaper reporter and editor, I’ve seen just about all manner of stories, from the mundane to the dramatic, the humorous to the deadly. But I’ve never witnessed any story that has had as many…

entry.title: New Oregon Waterway Permit Requirements Take Effect in 2026
entry.summary: Oregon’s new 2026 waterway rules require nearly all paddlecraft: kayaks, SUPs, rafts, and more - to carry a Waterway Access Permit. Fees start at $6, with funds supporting access, safety, and invasive species prevention statewide.

entry.title: LOW COMING ONSHORE TO BRING MORE RAIN TO THE UMPQUA VALLEY

entry.title: ROSEBURG RAINFALL TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT BELOW NORMAL FOR 2025
entry.summary: January 2, 2025 6:40 a.m. The Umpqua Valley received significantly less rainfall than normal in 2025.
